title: Banged-up Commanders reunite with LB Smith
content: The Commanders signed veteran pass rusher Preston Smith, bolstering a defensive line that just lost one of its starters.

title: Townsend apologizes for criticizing Chinese food
content: American tennis star Taylor Townsend has apologized "from the bottom of my heart" for making disparaging comments about Chinese food on social media.

title: Raleigh passes Mantle, ties Griffey with 55, 56
content: Seattle's Cal Raleigh broke Mickey Mantle's record for homers by a switch-hitter then tied Ken Griffey Jr. for most home runs in franchise history in the next at-bat.

title: Eagles LT: Tush push chatter makes 'blood boil'
content: Eagles left tackle Jordan Mailata has had enough of the media narrative that his team won Sunday's Super Bowl rematch against the Chiefs because of the tush push.

title: Dodgers bullpen spoils Ohtani's 5 no-hit IP, 50th HR
content: Shohei Ohtani threw five no-hit innings Tuesday night against an imposing Phillies lineup before exiting as a pitcher, only to watch the Dodgers' bullpen implode again in a 9-6 loss.

title: Fever leap another hurdle, stay alive in G2 rout
content: The Fever proved their resilience yet again, proving they aren't done yet after a 77-60 throttling of the Dream on Tuesday to force a winner-take-all Game 3.

title: Gators' Juluke gets 3 games for role in LSU scuffle
content: Florida suspended assistant coach Jabbar Juluke for three games for his role in an altercation before last Saturday's game against LSU.

title: Source: Vikings RB Jones (hamstring) hits IR
content: The Vikings placed running back Aaron Jones on injured reserve Tuesday because of a hamstring injury, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: üèà Fantasy pickups: Daniel Jones among options
content: Highlighting available signal-callers after an injury-filled weekend, as well as other helpful options ahead of Week 3.

title: Real or just a mirage? Let's rate the sustainability of 32 NFL surprises through two games
content: Which shocking early statistical trends have staying power, and which are a product of a small sample size? Our NFL Nation reporters break it down.

title: What we're hearing: Latest on Aaron Rodgers, Bengals' plans without Joe Burrow
content: Our insiders have intel on Rodgers' first two games in Pittsburgh, Cincinnati's post-Burrow scramble and more.

title: 'They're done building around him': Inside the tumultuous Kawhi Leonard era in Los Angeles
content: Just weeks after the Clippers shocked the NBA world by signing the 2019 NBA MVP, a feeling percolated across the organization: fear.

title: Giants are giving Jaxson Dart the Patrick Mahomes treatment ... but for how long?
content: Dart's job is to sit and learn behind Russell Wilson. Can the Giants stay patient and let him develop?

title: Bowling Green's unofficial mascot, Pudge the cat, is more than just a smushy face
content: Bowling Green may have a former Heisman Trophy winner for a coach, but the biggest star on this team is a cat.

title: Which NFL teams are rising -- and falling -- after two weeks? Here's our fresh 1-32 Power Rankings poll
content: It's time for new NFL Power Rankings after two weeks! We stacked the best teams and named the biggest QB takeaway for each roster.

content: Not all upsets are created equal, but when upsets like NIU-Notre Dame or others happen, they have some common traits.

title: Bottom 10: Where the teams aren't hot, but the coaches' seats are
content: The head coaches at UCLA and Virginia Tech already are toast -- and the temperature is rising for others.

title: The John Cena eras: From Ruthless Aggression to 17-time WWE champ
content: We highlight the key moments from Cena's remarkable 23-year career before he retires the jorts in December.

title: What defines an ace in 2025? Breaking down what success looks like for today's star pitchers
content: Paul Skenes and Tarik Skubal are having great seasons within the context of modern baseball. But how do they compare to aces of the past? Let's find out.

title: 'It's a violent play': Why the rest of the NFL isn't using the tush push
content: The Eagles have converted the tush push 96.6% of the time on fourth-and-1, so why don't all teams use it? Here's why.

title: Matchup rankings: Javonte Williams, DK Metcalf stand out in Week 3
content: Matchups are the key to fantasy lineup decisions. Here are the most and least favorable for Week 3 at QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: Rest-of-season rankings: Adams, Jones climb; Jeanty drops
content: Eric Karabell updates his rankings at every position for the rest of the season, including his top 100 overall.

title: Arsenal show at Athletic that they possess the depth to win UCL
content: Subs Gabriel Martinelli and Leandro Trossard powered Arsenal past Athletic Club on Tuesday, showing off the depth needed to win the Champions League.

title: Champions League recap: 10-man Madrid defeat Marseille, Juve draw with Dortmund
content: Here's how Tuesday's action unfolded. Real Madrid hung on, while Juventus and Dortmund provided entertainment.

title: Men's pound-for-pound rankings: Crawford takes top spot; where does Canelo land?
content: Terence Crawford delivered an impressive performance and moved up, but what about Canelo Alvarez? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: CFP Bubble Watch: An early look at every Power 4 team
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and questions around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: MVP Tracker 4.0: Chawinga, Esther fighting for the crown
content: Less than 25% of the NWSL regular season is left, and the race to be crowned the league's MVP is heating up.

title: Who are the breakout U21 Champions League players you don't know?
content: With a host of young players in the Champions League squads, we look at the next breakout stars under the age of 21 this season.

title: Is Mbapp√© the quickest Real Madrid player to 50 goals? Not even close
content: Kylian Mbapp√© is the fastest player to reach a half-century of goals for Real Madrid since Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United's Kobbie Mainoo wanted by Newcastle
content: Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is a January target for Newcastle United. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: How farming and family forged Eagles center Cam Jurgens
content: Cam Jurgens led the Eagles to a Super Bowl title while playing with a herniated disc. If that sounds tough, wait until you hear about his dad and a scraggly barn cat.

title: NBA Future Power Rankings: Is your favorite team built to last?
content: Where could the next three seasons take your favorite team? Our NBA insiders are mapping out the futures of all 30.

title: Francisco Lindor homers shortly after wife, Katia, performs national anthem on violin
content: Katia Lindor minored in music at St. Mary's University in Texas and is a classically trained violinist.

title: Ovechkin cereal hits shelves with nods to Capitals star's career
content: 'Ovi's Great Crunch' will be available exclusively at Giant Food stores in the Washington, D.C., area.

title: 10 tips to help you win your league this season
content: Andre Snellings lays out what it takes to put yourself in the best position to win your fantasy basketball league.

title: BMW crash: No bail for accused Gaganpreet; bus, ambulance also guilty, says lawyer
content: A Delhi court rejected bail for Gaganpreet Makkad, the accused in the BMW accident case involving the death of Navjot Singh. Her judicial custody is extended until September 27. Makkad's lawyer highlighted the delayed FIR and questioned the culpable homicide charge. The defense also raised concerns about a DTC bus and ambulance inaction.

title: SIR in Delhi: EC prepares for revision exercise; uploads voter list of SIR-2002
content: Delhi is preparing for a special intensive revision of electoral polls. The Election Commission has uploaded the 2002 voter list and mapped it with current constituencies. This follows a meeting with state election officials to assess preparedness. A pan-India special revision is expected soon, replacing the annual summary revision.

title: 'Tarnished son's reputation': Father of AI 171 pilot slams AAIB; seeks 'formal' probe
content: The father of Captain Sumeet Sabharwal, who perished in the Air India Ahmedabad crash that killed 260, is demanding a formal government inquiry, expressing distress over alleged leaks suggesting his son was suicidal. He refutes claims about his son's mental state, citing his extensive flying experience and lack of prior incidents.

title: Amazon CEO‚Äôs warning: Company‚Äôs culture may be at risk; needs a reset
content: Andy Jassy, Amazon CEO, focuses on improving company culture. He aims to reduce bureaucracy and flatten the organizational structure. Amazon reintroduced a five-day work week. The company plans to increase worker-to-manager ratio. An email initiative helps employees flag unnecessary processes. Amazon laid off over 27,000 employees since 2022. AI integration may further reduce the corporate workforce in the coming years.

title: 'Welcome those who assimilate': Trump's stark message for new US citizens
content: US president Trump will now send a congratulatory letter to all new US citizens, emphasising the "sacred bond" they form with the nation's history, culture, and values. The letter, included in the citizenship packet, reminds them of their oath and the freedoms and opportunities the US offers.

title: ‚ÄòAct of terror‚Äô: Man rams car into FBI Pittsburgh office gate; manhunt on
content: Donald Henson, a former military member, is wanted after allegedly ramming a car into the FBI's Pittsburgh field office early Wednesday. Authorities are investigating the incident as a potential act of terror. Henson reportedly crashed into the gate, placed an American flag on it, and fled on foot. A message was found scrawled on the car, which is being examined.

title: 'No interference ...': Rajnath Singh on Op Sindoor pause; big warning for Pak
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh praised the Indian Army's bravery, citing a Jaish-e-Mohammed commander's admission about the devastation caused by Operation Sindoor, which targeted Masood Azhar's family. PM Modi echoed this, highlighting the operation's success in bringing Pakistan to its knees and emphasizing India's strengthened stance against terrorism.

title: OpenAI exec to students: CS degree pays off, but learn AI to stay ahead
content: OpenAI's Codex lead, Alexander Embiricos, advises computer science students to embrace AI tools, warning against programs that prohibit their use. He emphasizes the continued value of CS degrees due to the growing demand for software engineers, while highlighting the importance of practical experience and adaptability in problem-solving for new graduates.

title: Bigger, in colour: EC's new norms for EVM ballot papers; roll-out in Bihar polls
content: The Election Commission has introduced revised guidelines for the design and printing of EVM ballot papers to improve clarity for voters, particularly in the upcoming Bihar assembly election. These changes include larger color photographs of candidates, uniform font sizes for names, and the use of pink-colored 70 GSM paper for assembly elections.

title: Lodha Developers 'fraud' case: Crime branch arrests ex-director Rajendra N Lodha
content: Mumbai's crime branch has apprehended Rajendra N. Lodha, along with accomplices, for allegedly defrauding Lodha Developers of Rs 85 crore. The real estate firm accused its former director, Rajendra Narpatmal Lodha, his son, and associates of fraud, misappropriation, and criminal breach of trust. Rajendra Lodha is accused of unauthorized property sales, undervaluing land deals, and illegal TDR transactions.

title: Bahrain visa for Indians: On-arrival access, application tips, and entry rules
content: Indian citizens visiting Bahrain can obtain a visa on arrival for short stays, provided they meet basic entry requirements. Alternatively, travellers may apply online in advance by submitting necessary documents. This guide explains eligibility criteria, required paperwork, step-by-step application procedures, and arrival protocols at Bahrain International Airport, helping ensure a smooth and well-prepared travel experience.

title: Lesson for founders: Zerodha CEO cites Nvidia chief; says success takes time
content: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath drew parallels between his firm's journey and Nvidia's, emphasizing the significance of timing and perseverance. Starting with a modest ‚Çπ10 lakh investment, Zerodha leveraged free infrastructure and focused on customer-centric policies like 'no spam, no tracking'. Kamath attributes Zerodha's success to being in the right place at the right time, coinciding with India's economic rise.

title: 'SpaceX' cocaine: Oz pilot dies in plane crash; cops find 200kg of drugs
content: A plane crashed in Brazil, revealing a shocking discovery. Authorities found approximately 200 kg of cocaine concealed in SpaceX-labeled packaging. The Australian pilot, Timothy J. Clark, was found dead at the crash site. The plane, registered in Zambia, had extra fuel tanks. Police are investigating the drug trafficking operation and the pilot's knowledge of Brazilian air routes.

title: Destiny banned from Twitch: Elon Musk, conservatives blamed; income wiped out
content: Political streamer Destiny, Steven Bonnell II, faces a Twitch ban he attributes to a coordinated effort by Elon Musk and conservatives, alleging it's free speech issues following controversial comments on Charlie Kirk. Destiny claims his income is eliminated due to the ban, triggered by 'Hateful Conduct' accusations related to discrimination.

title: 'Navalny poisoned': Wife says labs reveal foul play; claims Putin responsible
content: Yulia Navalnaya, wife of Alexei Navalny, alleges that independent lab tests confirm he was poisoned while in prison. Navalny, a prominent critic of Vladimir Putin, died in February 2024. The labs, located in two countries, concluded that Navalny was killed by poisoning. Navalny previously survived a poisoning attempt in 2020.

title: SBI branch looted: Gang barges in, ties up staff, flees with Rs 20 crore haul
content: In a brazen heist, three masked men robbed a State Bank of India branch in Vijayapura, Karnataka, making off with over Rs 21 crore in cash and gold. Armed with country-made pistols and knives, the suspects tied up the bank staff before fleeing in a Suzuki EVA with a fake number plate.

title: Pakistan vs UAE in doubt? ACC social media post creates further chaos
content: Tensions escalate within the Pakistan camp ahead of their crucial Asia Cup match against UAE, as the ACC unexpectedly deleted its social media post promoting the game, raising concerns about Pakistan's participation.

title: 'Brain-eating amoeba' claims 19 lives in Kerala
content: Kerala is on high alert following 19 deaths from Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM) this year, with 69 cases reported. While no clusters are linked to single water sources like in 2024, health officials have heightened surveillance after the Nipah outbreak. Authorities are urging chlorination and testing, but treatment remains challenging due to limited options.

title: 'Our soldiers brought Pak to its knees': PM Modi reacts to JeM commander's video; hails Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Modi, celebrating his 75th birthday in Madhya Pradesh, lauded Operation Sindoor's success, citing a Jaish-e-Muhammed commander's video confession. The commander admitted the operation devastated Maulana Masood Azhar's family and JeM's Bahawalpur headquarters on May 7. Modi asserted that this "new India" fears no threats and strikes within enemy territory, prioritizing national security after Pakistani terrorists harmed Indian citizens.

title: BJ Penn Arrested: UFC icon faces charges in Hawaii
content: UFC legend BJ Penn faces renewed legal troubles after his recent arrest in Hawai'i for allegedly violating a protective order. This incident, occurring on September 15, marks another entry in a series of concerning run-ins with the law. Penn's arrest also raises questions about his well-being and how it overshadows his celebrated MMA career

title: Sebi leases Rs 7 lakh/month luxury flat for chairman - check details here
content: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) has leased a luxurious five-bedroom apartment in Mumbai's Prabhadevi for its chairman, Tuhin Kanta Pandey, at a monthly rent of Rs 7 lakh. The three-year lease includes a 3,000 sq. ft. apartment with four car parks and a 5% annual rent escalation, aligning with Sebi's policy for leased accommodations.

title: The void between India and Pakistan is not just in skills, but also the way they train
content: Watching India and Pakistan train in Dubai highlighted the gulf between the two sides. India‚Äôs discipline, punctuality and structured sessions contrasted starkly with Pakistan‚Äôs disorganised approach. While Indian batters endured rigorous drills under coaches, Pakistan turned to casual football and trial-and-error practice ‚Äî mirroring their struggles on the field.

title: 'Priyanka Chopra had bad skin, she is big-boned': Prahlad Kakkar lauds actress
content: Priyanka Chopra's journey from a pageant winner to a Bollywood star and then to Hollywood is lauded by adman Prahlad Kakkar. He reveals that she overcame disadvantages like her complexion and build with hard work and determination. Kakkar praises her ambition, focus, and dignity, especially regarding her personal life, highlighting her resilience in restarting her career in a new industry.

title: ‚ÄòCome to Vizag‚Äô: Andhra IT minister Nara Lokesh invites BlackBuck CEO Rajesh Yabaji
content: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh extended an invitation to BlackBuck's CEO Rajesh Yabaji to relocate the company to Visakhapatnam, following Yabaji's announcement of leaving Bengaluru's Outer Ring Road due to severe commuting issues. This move has ignited concerns within Bengaluru's IT sector regarding governance and infrastructure, prompting calls for government intervention to address deteriorating road conditions and public utilities.

title: PM Modi turns 75: Trump dials 'friend', Meloni posts selfie; wishes pour in
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi celebrated his 75th birthday with global leaders extending their heartfelt wishes, acknowledging his leadership and India's growing global influence. US President Donald Trump, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, and New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon lauded PM Modi's friendship and vision. Former UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu also conveyed their greetings, emphasising strong bilateral ties.

title: 'Why you asking for my wife's number': Foreign tourist confronts man in Amritsar - watch
content: A video from Amritsar shows a foreign tourist confronting a local man for inappropriately asking his wife for her phone number. The tourist questioned the man's behavior, deeming it "strange." Social media users expressed frustration, sharing similar experiences of harassment faced by women in India. One user recounted incidents of strangers incessantly requesting photos with his girlfriend.

title: 'Decided not to play': How Vaishali's Chennai nightmare helped her win Grand Swiss
content: Grandmaster R Vaishali secured her spot in the Women‚Äôs Candidates Tournament 2026 by winning the Women‚Äôs Grand Swiss in Samarkand. This victory came after a challenging experience at the Chennai Grand Masters, where she faced a series of losses. Ironically, her lowered rating from the Chennai tournament inadvertently contributed to her Grand Swiss win due to tie-break calculations.

title: GST rate cuts: FM says reforms to inject Rs 2L cr; claims 'people will have cash in hand'
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced that GST rate cuts, effective September 22, are expected to inject Rs 2 lakh crore into the economy. Post-reform, most items have shifted to lower tax brackets. Companies are reportedly reducing rates, passing benefits to consumers.

title: 'Not a fan': Dana White makes blunt confession about WWE
content: UFC President Dana White reiterated his disinterest in WWE in 2025. He acknowledged the athleticism of WWE performers, praising Logan Paul. White emphasized the difference between UFC's real combat and WWE's scripted entertainment. He recalled his disagreement with Lawrence Epstein's crossover fan idea from 2023. White maintains his focus remains solely on the fight game.

title: ‚ÄòSevere pain‚Äô: India‚Äôs exports to US fall drastically on Trump‚Äôs 50% tariffs; check details
content: India's exports to the US have been declining for three consecutive months, with August experiencing a significant 16.3% drop due to increased tariffs imposed by the US. The impact is uneven, heavily affecting sectors like apparel and gems, potentially leading to substantial export losses and job cuts.

title: Hands tied, lashed with leather belt, kicked: Andhra woman tortured by husband
content: Andhra Pradesh police are searching for Balraju, who is accused of tying his first wife, Bhagyamma, to a pole and assaulting her in Prakasam district on September 13. The incident stemmed from Balraju's suspicion of infidelity and Bhagyamma's refusal to provide money for his medical treatment, as she is the sole caretaker of their four children.

title: Asia Cup handshake row: AAP slams Suryakumar Yadav, BCCI
content: The Aam Aadmi Party has escalated the India-Pakistan handshake controversy, with leader Saurabh Bharadwaj challenging Suryakumar Yadav and the BCCI. Bharadwaj urged them to donate match earnings to the Pahalgam terror attack victims' widows.

title: 'Action will be taken': IPL chairman on PCB's complaint; clarifies ICC will review
content: Following a handshake controversy during the Asia Cup clash, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) lodged a complaint against match referee Andy Pycroft, requesting his removal. While the ICC rejected the initial appeal, Pycroft has been "rested" for Pakistan's upcoming match.

title: 'Woh toh dabayenge na': Dhanashree Verma reacts to rumours of cheating Chahal
content: Dhanashree Verma, following her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, addresses rumors of infidelity on the reality show 'Rise And Fall.' She dismisses divorce gossip as fabricated and hints at revealing her side of the story, suggesting Chahal fears her speaking out. Dhanashree also declares she's currently uninterested in finding love, humorously comparing herself to Salman Khan.

title: Childless woman burnt alive on cow dung pile; in-laws attack cops during cremation attempt
content: In a shocking incident in Alwar's Deeg district, Sarla Devi was allegedly burnt alive by her in-laws due to years of harassment for being childless. When police intervened to investigate, they were attacked by villagers attempting to cremate the body.

title: Patna high court orders Congress to remove AI video on PM Modi‚Äôs mother
content: Patna High Court has ordered Congress to remove an AI-generated video from social media platforms featuring PM Modi and his late mother, Heeraben Modi. The video, shared by Bihar Congress, depicted Modi's mother criticizing his politics, sparking outrage from BJP leaders who condemned it as disrespectful and shameful.

title: Agra: Elderly couple die as e-scooter on charge catches fire; granddaughter survives
content: In a tragic incident in Agra, an elderly couple died in a fire caused by an e-scooter that was charging indoors. Their 14-year-old granddaughter escaped to alert her parents. The victims, aged 95 and 85, were sleeping on the ground floor when the scooter's battery exploded. The son alleges negligence by the manufacturer, as the battery was still under warranty.

title: How much revenue will Pakistan lose if they pull out of the Asia Cup?
content: Pakistan's threat to withdraw from the Asia Cup over a referee dispute could cost them millions in revenue, potentially jeopardising their financial stability within the Asian Cricket Council. This potential decision, driven by PCB chief Naqvi's criticism of the match referee, risks a significant loss from broadcast deals and sponsorships.

title: Trump ramps up attacks on NYT after $15bn lawsuit
content: Donald Trump has launched a $15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times, accusing the newspaper of a long-standing smear campaign. Filed in Florida, the suit targets several reporters, the paper, and its publisher, citing articles and a book as evidence of malicious defamation.

title: Pak Ex-PM Imran Khan Alleges ISI Conducting His Military Trial In Jail
content: Pakistan's jailed former prime minister Imran Khan on Wednesday alleged that he is facing a military trial in jail as it's not being conducted by a civilian judge but by an ISI officer, who takes instructions directly from Army Chief Asim Munir.

title: Farm Leader's Plea Says Deboarded From Train On Way To Protests, Court Junks It
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court disposed of a petition filed by farmer leader P Ayyakannu, who alleged repeated obstruction of his travel to New Delhi to participate in protests.

title: Indian-Origin Heart Surgeon Guilty Of Sexual Offences Gets 6 Year Jail In UK
content: An Indian-origin heart surgeon convicted of abusing his position to sexually assault female members of staff at a National Health Service (NHS) hospital in northern England has been jailed for six years.

title: Man Kills Stray Dog Near Mumbai, Gouges Out Eyeball And Plays With It
content: A man in Maharashtra killed a stray dog and was later found on the road playing with one of its eyeballs. The shocking incident took place in Mumbra, on the outskirts of Mumbai.

title: Poll Body's New Reform, Candidates' Photos On Voting Machines, Begins From Bihar
content: The Election Commission of India has made some changes to make Electronic Voting Machine ballot papers clearer and more voter-friendly.

title: 22-Year-Old Delhi Man Stabbed To Death, Minors Among 5 Detained: Cops
content: A 22-year-old call centre employee was allegedly stabbed to death by five people, including four minors, following a quarrel in southeast Delhi's Tughlakabad forest area, officials said on Wednesday.

title: 150 Categories Of Products Cheaper After GST Cut, Says Mother Dairy Chief
content: A reduction in GST rates will result in more than 150 categories of products getting cheaper from September 22, the company's Managing Director Manish Bandlish told NDTV.

title: Another Man Arrested For Sex Abuse Of Boy In Dating App Case, Total Now 10
content: The Kerala police arrested a civil contractor in connection with the ongoing investigation into the sexual assault of a 16-year-old boy, taking the total arrests in the case to 10.

title: 7 Of Family Killed In Truck-Car Collision In Andhra Pradesh: Police
content: Seven members of a family were killed when a sand-laden truck collided with their car in Nellore district on Wednesday, police said.

title: Car Rams FBI Building Gate In Pittsburgh, Driver Leaves Behind American Flag
content: A driver rammed a car into a security gate at the FBI building in Pittsburgh early Wednesday, then removed an American flag from the back seat and threw it over the gate before leaving, authorities said.

title: Cops Try To Arrest Accused In Delhi Locality, Get Thrashed By His Relatives
content: Several Delhi Police personnel were injured in an attack by a group of men while attempting to arrest a person in Delhi's Fatehpur Beri area on Tuesday.

title: Centre Plans Big Push For E-Commerce Exports, Talks On With Amazon, Flipkart
content: The government, in a huge push for export in the wake of the US imposition of 50 per cent tariff, will set up special export entities tied to e-commerce platforms.

title: 'Brain-Eating Amoeba' Kills 19 In Kerala. How It Spreads, How To Stay Safe
content: Kerala health authorities are on alert after a spike in cases of Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM), a brain infection with a high fatality rate. This infection is caused by Naegleria fowleri, commonly known as the 'brain-eating amoeba'

title: 1 Dead, 3 Critical After Falling Into Sewer In Delhi's Ashok Vihar: Police
content: A 40-year-old man died and three others were hospitalised in critical condition after losing consciousness while cleaning a sewer in northwest Delhi's Ashok Vihar, an official said on Wednesday.

title: Maoist Ceasefire Exposed Within 24 Hours, Two Civilians Killed in Chhattisgarh
content: The Maoists' dramatic ceasefire offer has collapsed within a day of its announcement, with two civilians brutally killed in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur and Dantewada districts

title: Alexei Navalny's Wife Says Tests Show Her Husband Was Poisoned
content: The wife of Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny said Wednesday that laboratory analysis of smuggled biological samples found he was killed by poisoning while incarcerated at an Arctic prison in February 2024.

title: "No Power Can Dare To Challenge India's Sovereignty": Rajnath Singh
content: Rajnath Singh on Wednesday hailed the bravery and courage of the Indian armed forces during Operation Sindoor, highlighting how under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, no power can "dare to challenge India's sovereignty.

title: Odisha Woman Raped, Threatened By Husband's Colleague
content: A woman in Odisha's Balangir district was allegedly raped by her husband's colleague. The accused later threatened to kill her if she disclosed the assault.

title: Odisha Teacher Thrashes 31 Students With Stick. They Hadn't Touched Her Feet
content: A school teacher from Odisha's Mayurbhanj district was suspended for beating up 31 students who did not touch her feet after morning prayer.

title: "If It's A Woman, You Can Give Bail," BMW Crash Accused Tells Court
content: The death of a senior finance ministry official in a BMW crash with a two-wheeler in Delhi last week is unfortunate but one cannot overlook that at least 5,000 accidents are also reported across the country every year, the court was told.

title: Education Department told to fill 5,267 vacant teacher posts in Kalyana Karnataka, says CM
content: It will address shortage of teachers and help improve SSLC results in the seven districts of the region, according to Siddaramaiah

title: New study finds how calcium and pH regulate ovarian cancer spheroids
content: Dr. Tapomoy Bhattacharjee‚Äôs lab at the NCBS in collaboration with Dr. Ramray Bhat‚Äôs lab at the Indian Institute of Science (IISc.), conducted this interdisciplinary work published in the scientific journal, Small.

title: Financial irregularities found at Kerala‚Äôs Periyar Tiger Reserve
content: Financial mismanagement uncovered in recent inspection. Report reveals that PTR authorities established a Park Welfare Fund in 2004 and diverted tourism-related income into it without requisite government approval

title: India, Papua New Guinea discuss ways to further enhance bilateral ties
content: Minister of State for External Affairs Pabitra Margherita visited Papua New Guinea at the invitation of its government

title: Assam unveils concert tourism policy, Post Malone to perform in Guwahati on December 8
content: After Meghalaya‚Äôs model, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma says global stars will boost Assam‚Äôs tourism and economy

title: Bengaluru scientists develop affordable fruit fly trap; seek global patents
content: The device has completed successful multi-location trials and is now seeking patent in the US, Europe, Japan, China and Australia.¬†¬†

title: TTD invites Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu for the annual Brahmotsavams
content: The Chief Minister emphasises the need for meticulous planning to ensure comfort and safety of the devotees during the nine-day festivities

title: Pawan Kalyan salutes the spirit of Telangana‚Äôs fight against the Nizams
content: It was due to the police action led by Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel that the people of Telangana got freedom, he says

title: Assembly discusses fallout of amoebic meningoencephalitis in Kerala
content: While Opposition questions government‚Äôs competency in dealing with the crisis,  Health Minister says State has formulated clear guidelines for the public and technical guidelines for doctors, including a treatment protocol.

title: Owaisi criticises BJP Assam for promoting anti-Muslim sentiment through AI video
content: The BJP is doing this everywhere and is a deliberate attempt to make Muslims realise that they are second class citizens of India, Mr Owaisi said

title: Birthday wishes pour in for PM Modi
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that under Narendra Modi‚Äôs leadership, India has become a centre of global aspirations

title: YouTuber ‚ÄòSavukku‚Äô Shankar seeks protection¬†
content: Mr. Shankar claimed he had recently exposed some wrongdoings of the two IPS¬†officers, following which they had¬†developed a personal grudge against him.¬†

title: Producers of Ajith Kumar-starrer Good Bad Ugly urge Madras High Court to vacate injunction in favour of Ilaiyaraaja
content: Justice N. Senthilkumar directs the musician to file his counter affidavit by September 24 to the plea made by the Telangana-based production firm

title: Gorakhpur NEET aspirant's murder: Police arrest one of the accused after encounter
content: In a joint operation, police teams from Pipraich and Kushinagar nabbed a ‚Äúsmuggler‚Äù identified as Rahim in Kushinagar after an exchange of fire, officials said

title: SHRC orders probe into living conditions of settlers in Chengara protest land
content: A team will be formed to identify deficiencies in road access. Officials asked to look into lack of piped water and electricity and submit report within six weeks. Move follows a report that appeared in The Hindu on the plight of children in Chengara protest land

title: Search operation launched near International Border in Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs Kathua
content: The search operation was jointly launched by the Special Operations Group (SOG) of the local police and CRPF in the area of Dholka-Sanyal nursery along the possible infiltration route around 3 p.m.

title: 98% Education dept budget spent on salaries; Telangana for complete overhaul of system to meet international standards: CM Revanth
content: Telangana CM, who is also Education Minister, said over 1.1 lakh engineering students graduate every year and only 15% them were able to secure jobs

title: Animal rights group raises alarm over Wildlife Protection (Kerala Amendment) Bill
content: The proposed amendments can undermine conservation efforts and worsen human-wildlife conflict in Kerala, warns Humane World for Animals India

title: Supreme Court, Centre differ over stubble-burning; CJI backs prosecution, government prefers policy route
content: The CJI advocated a return to criminal prosecution of errant agriculturists, even a separate legislation; the Centre maintained that it was a policy to take farmers along

title: ‚ÄòLine patrols‚Äô along overhead lines revealed 45,200 defects, more than 15,000 rectified: Electricity Minister K. Krishnankutty
content: The Power department is exploring the possibilities in artificial intelligence in preventing electrical accidents, Minister tells Assembly

title: BWSSB resumes Cauvery water supply in Bengaluru
content: Earlier, the BWSSB had announced that the city would face disruptions in Cauvery water supply from September 15 to 17

title: Missing Odisha woman constable found murdered in Keonjhar
content: Deceased Subhamitra Sahoo, a native of Paradip in Jagatsinghpur district and posted in Bhubaneswar, disappeared after leaving home for duty on September 6, police said.

title: High price of gold, oil reason for Kerala‚Äôs high retail inflation rate, says Finance Minister K.N. Balagopal
content: The inflation rate in Kerala stood at 9.04%, the highest among major States, according to the year-on-year inflation rate based on the all-India Consumer Price Index for the month of August

title: Ramadoss, estranged son Anbumani pay separate tributes on anniversary of Vanniyar reservation agitation
content: Mr. Anbumani, accompanied by his supporters, paid tributes at Sithani and a few other places in Villupuram district

title: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah visits rain-affected areas in Kalaburagi, interacts with distressed¬†farmers who reported crop loss
content: The Chief Minister inspected the 27.23-acre farm land belonging to¬†farmers Channabasappa and Suryakant (Survey No. 50), where a tur crop had been completely destroyed

title: Kerala HC orders probe into ‚Äòreduced weight‚Äô of gold-cladded Dwarapalaka idols at Sabarimala temple
content: The weight of the idols reduced by 4kg. Court seeks to know why the idols‚Äô weight was not checked in 2019 prior to their reinstallation at the temple

title: Union government releases first instalment of united grants to T.N. rural local bodies
content: The allocated grants are recommended and released in two instalments in a financial year, a release said

title: Delhi riots conspiracy case: Five years on, activists demand fair trial for Umar Khalid, others
content: At a public meet held at Mumbai Marathi Patrakar Sangh, speakers decried five years of ‚Äòinjustice‚Äô in Delhi riots case

title: Waste collection, processing in Kerala has improved drastically post-Brahmapuram fire, Minister tells Assembly
content: Replying to a Calling Attention motion, M.B. Rajesh says collection and processing of non-biodegradable waste in Kerala had risen from 47% in March 2023 to 98% at present

title: Hyundai Motor India signs wage pact with its recognised union
content: The long-term wage settlement will be effective from April 1, 2024, through March 31, 2027, the company said in a statement.

title: When ragas ride the waves: ‚ÄòMalhar and the Sea‚Äô music festival reclaims Goa‚Äôs classical glory
content: The festival, held recently at ITC Grand by Arossim beach, showed how classical music is as much a part of the region‚Äôs musical tradition as Fado and folk music.

title: AIADMK leaders ‚Äòsatisfied‚Äô with outcome of meeting with Amit Shah in New Delhi

title: Jairam Ramesh hits back at Centre over its rebuttal of his charges on Dhirauli coal mine project
content: As far as the second claim is concerned, the Forest Rights Act, 2006 includes not just individual forest rights but also community forest resource rights (CFR) and habitat rights of particularly vulnerable tribal groups (PVTGs), Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said

title: Kalyana Karnataka benefited significantly after Article 371(J) was implemented: Minister
content: The Minister said that considering the backwardness of the region, the UPA government, under the leadership of veteran leader Mallikarjun Kharge, brought an amendment to Article 371, giving a special status to the region

title: Kerala Assembly: Health department blindsided by recurrence of amoebic meningoencephalitis cases, says Opposition Leader
content: Satheesan says Kerala government lacks a treatment protocol and remains clueless about the disease‚Äôs provenance and spread across the State

content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan grant liberty to the couple to approach the National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission

title: Sikh leaders in Pakistan urge India to lift ban on pilgrims travelling to Guru Nanak‚Äôs shrine
content: The Central government has denied permission for Sikhs to cross into Pakistan for Guru Nanak‚Äôs birth anniversary, citing security concerns

title: Karnataka government releases ‚Çπ125 crore to newly-formed corporations in Bengaluru
content: The new corporations have been established under the Greater Bengaluru Administration Act, 2024 through a government notification issued on September 2, 2025.¬†

title: Supreme Court reverses 2022 verdict on Haryana village common lands, restores proprietors‚Äô rights
content: Allowing the plea seeking review of its own judgement, a Bench comprising Chief Justice B.R. Gavai and Justices Prashant Kumar Mishra and K.V. Viswanathan set aside the 2022 verdict

title: Gourangalal Das to be India's new Envoy to South Korea
content: Das played a key role in the negotiations between India and China to rebuild their ties that came under severe strain following the over four-year-long eastern Ladakh border standoff

title: Indo-US research collaboration identifies cholesterol‚Äôs role in irreversible hair loss
content: The study uncovers an unrecognised role of cholesterol intermediates in governing hair follicle regeneration.

title: Telangana CM says people with relatives in politics too will not be spared if engaged in drug activity

title: Yellow Line of Namma Metro cuts peak-hour congestion by 37.5% on south Bengaluru roads
